meanings.definition: Having a pink or red color like a rose.
meanings.sent1: The flowers in the garden were the rosiest I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: She wore the rosiest dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The sky turned the rosiest shade during the sunset.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks glowed with the rosiness of a fresh rose.
meanings.sent5: The rosiness of the sunrise painted the whole sky in hues of pink and red.

meanings.sent1: Despite the rain, she had the rosiest smile on her face.
meanings.sent2: His rosiness was contagious, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's wagging tail was a picture of pure rosiness.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room with the rosiness of joy.
meanings.sent5: The rosiness of her outlook brightened even the gloomiest days.

meanings.sent1: Among all the flowers, the rose stood out as the rosiest.
meanings.sent2: The rosiness of her cheeks was a sign of good health.
meanings.sent3: He proudly displayed the award for the rosiness of his garden.
meanings.sent4: The rosiness of the sunset was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: In the garden competition, her roses were declared the rosiness of them all.
